View_Interfaces

Interface IDialog

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IView, java.util.Observer
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IErrorDialog, IFileChooser, IInfoDialog, ILoadingDialog, IWarningDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ErrorDialog, FileChooser, InfoDialog, LoadingDialog, WarningDialog

    public interface IDialog
extends IView
    This interface is used for dialogs to interact with the user by blocking all other views. It is based on IDialog and informs the controller that all views implementing this interface are modal.

    Subclasses of this interface provide different types of dialogs like:

    • IErrorDialog - informs user about error
    • IInfoDialog - informs user about state of system
    • IWarningDialog - warns user and gives him a choose of multiple options
    • ILoadingDialog - informs user about loading process
    • IFileChooser - let the user choose a file

    The further description of all dialogs are structured as follows:

    • Usage - how to use the dialog
    • View actions on view - which ViewActions are provided to the user
    • Creation - how to create such a dialog

    Caution:
    Some dialogs block by calling IView.showView() the current running thread. Please see under Usage of the specific dialog for further information.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    9045534
    See Also:
    IView, IErrorDialog, IInfoDialog, IWarningDialog, ILoadingDialog

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface View_Interfaces.IView

        addController, bringToFront, destruct, getViewMenu, showView

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.Observer

        update
